page.title: 14Religion in Occold
page.content: The Baptist Chapel is opposite the school.It was built on a piece of land belonging to the shop and was then only half the present size.A gale blowing at about 90 miles an hour one Sunday morning made this building unsafe as it was so narrow.Another bit was built on nearly 100 years ago.This accounts for the double roof. The church was built at the end of the 12th.century.Rectors date back as far as 1320.A list hangs in the church.The clock dates back to 1704.The vestry,a loftty looking place, used to have an upper room where clergy that visited would stay and have their meals before there was a resident rector.There have bn three rectorys in the village.The first one stood near the road between the Church and the Parish Hall.The next one built 100 years ago was where Mr. Harlow lived,now it is a modern house.
